scenario:
S&P Global surpassed expectations for the fourth quarter with earnings of $3.77 per share on revenue of $3.59 billion, beating Wall Street's expectations of $3.47 per share in earnings on sales of $3.5 billion. The company's operating margin improved by 830 basis points to 36.5% in the quarter. For the full year, net income increased by 22% to $4.9 billion, with $1.1 billion in dividends and $3.3 billion in share repurchases returned to shareholders.

The company forecast full-year revenue growth of 5-7% and expects to earn between $17 and $17.25 per share for the year, surpassing Wall Street's $16.92-per-share consensus estimate. S&P Global reiterated its target to return 85% or more of the cash it generates to shareholders. The company's shares are up 445% over the past decade, outpacing the 193% performance of the S&P 500 index.
